question: What is the best mortgage option for me with an annual income of $75,000 and a credit score of 720?
true_answer: With an income of $75,000 and a credit score of 720, a fixed-rate mortgage with a down payment of 10-20% is recommended.

steps.content: What is the best mortgage option for me with an annual income of $75,000 and a credit score of 720?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for mortgage options. 2) Verify credit score with credit_agent. 3) Use calculator for affordability. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on suitable mortgage options for provided income and credit score.
Fixed-rate and adjustable-rate mortgages are common options. A credit score of 720 qualifies for most mortgages.
Credit score check: 720 is considered good, allowing for competitive interest rates.
Calculating affordability based on income of $75,000.
Loan affordability calculated. Monthly payments align well with income.
Are there any benefits to choosing an adjustable-rate mortgage?
Retrieving knowledge on benefits of adjustable-rate mortgages.
Adjustable-rate mortgages can offer lower initial rates, but may increase later.
Fixed-rate provides stability with consistent payments.
Review complete. All criteria and calculations verified.
Recommended: Fixed-rate mortgage with a down payment of 10-20% for stability.
With an income of $75,000 and a credit score of 720, a fixed-rate mortgage with a down payment of 10-20% is recommended.
